author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Omar Abdullah ruled out supporting the PDP in case it moves away from the BJP.

As government formation remains elusive in the State after Mufti Muhammad Sayeed’s demise, National Conference (NC) working president Omar Abdullah on Thursday blew the poll bugle and asked its cadre to prepare for it.

“Our youth cadre should start going door-to-door and spread the word about autonomy, which we believe is a solution [to the Kashmir problem]. However, at the same time, we are not opposed to any other idea being floated as a solution.

“Meanwhile, prepare for the urban local bodies polls and even Assembly elections. This time we will win with a thumping majority,” Mr. Abdullah told his supporters at a youth convention in Srinagar.

Mr. Abdullah’s remarks assume significance after the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and ally BJP failed to stake claim to form the government. After Chief Minister Sayeed’s death on January 7, J&K remains under Governor’s rule.

“If Mehbooba [Mufti] is not able to form the government then she should meet the Governor for dissolution of the Assembly,” he said.

Mr. Abdullah ruled out extending any outside support to the PDP in case it splits from the BJP.
title: Omar asks party cadre to get ready for polls
